item.title: Goodbye, Summer
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded:
Summer of 2016 went by way too quickly! Being on maternity leave meant we were able to take advantage of a few more trips away and lots of mid-week playdates with friends – it was a great summer and while I’m glad for the cooler weather, not as excited to have to get back to real life!

Some summer highlights:

Graeme arrived…

Maggie turned 3…

We had an overnight in York, ME with the McArdles…

went to Plymouth with some Healeys…

  

spent a week in Brewster…

 

 

celebrated as Janelle and Jared tied the knot…

 

got in some cousin time…

and lots of fun with friends!

      

 

This was definitely a summer to remember, I’m sad to see it go!

item.title: ¡Bienvenidos a Miami!
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded:
After seeing the Stuyck family over the summer, Maggie never stopped talking about her friend Pia and when we would see her again.  We figured, what better time to head to Miami than in the middle of winter here in Boston!

We arrived on the last Thursday in January and was able to meet up with my old colleague Harry in Ft Lauderdale.  Despite the rainy weather, we managed to grab lunch by the ocean and had some time catching up.  After lunch, Harry drove us to Coconut Grove to start the weekend with the Stuycks.

Maggie and Pia slipped right back into their BFF ways – again, you would have thought they had spent a huge amount of time together previously, not 36 hours!  We unfortunately didn’t have great weather the first few days so spent time hanging around the house, visited the local Children’s Museum, explored their neighborhood, and as always with toddlers, got in some park time.  On Saturday we finally made it to the beach, and while it wasn’t swimming weather, the sun and sand was all we needed to feel like we were on holiday!

The trip, as most, was too short, and we can’t wait to see Pia, Rafa, Chrissy, and Jaime again – most likely it’ll be after our new addition arrives so Pia will be able to impart all her big sister wisdom on Maggie!

item.title: Summer, Summer, Summertime.
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded:
This summer was full of activity – here are some highlights!

Ireland (see Erin Go Bragh post)

Maggie’s First Red Sox Game

Pat, Grandma, Auntie Mare, and I took Maggie to her first Red Sox game on June 13 (bonus – don’t need a ticket until they’re 2!) Fenway has really stepped up the kid-friendly atmosphere by adding in the “Clubhouse” area where you can color, build legos, take photos with Wally, and more! And best part was – it’s all air conditioned.  If you’re attempting to entertain a toddler for the length of a baseball game, this is the way to do it!

    

4th of July in NH

   

Cape Cod with the Healeys

 

Birthdays

We celebrated Maggie’s 2nd birthday (See Two.), Aoife’s 1st birthday, and Phelan’s 3rd birthday – there was plenty of fun and cake to go around!

Connecticut with Stuycks

A friend of mine from my time in London, Chrissy, has FINALLY made her way back stateside with her husband and two adorable children.  They are currently living in Miami, but when she was up visiting her family at their beach house in Connecticut for a few weeks, we couldn’t turn down the offer of a weekend getaway!  Maggie and Pia (Sophia, officially, who is just shy of 4) became fast friends and we haven’t stopped hearing about her every since! You’d think these two had known each other their whole lives and were instantly thick as thieves!

Paige’s Wedding

My BC roommate, Paige, was married in Provincetown near the end of summer and it gave Pat and I a blissful weekend away without Maggie (first full weekend since she was born!).  While she was off being entertained by her many grandparents, we enjoyed a weekend of sun, sand, cocktails, and belly laughs with all the BC biddies and buddies.  Can’t wait for the next wedding! (Looking at you, Janelle!!).

         

Jenni’s Wedding

The weekend following Paige’s wedding, Pat’s friend from college Jenni was married in Falmouth – being a more kid-friendly wedding, we brought Maggie with us to the Sea Crest Hotel (which I can NOT recommend more!) to enjoy some pool and beach time, plus experience her first wedding.  Living up to her mother’s (and Nana’s!) reputation of being a permanent fixture on any wedding dance floor, Maggie was the FIRST one up – and had quite a time twirling and dancing with Pat. (to many “awws” from all his friends!).  We are still hearing all about “Jenni the Princess” in her pretty white dress!

 

As the summer comes to a close, I’ve realized we really packed in a lot (and these were just the highlights!).  The only silver lining to summer ending is it brings in my favorite season – fall!

item.title: Erin Go Bragh
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded:
Having not been on a European vacation since Maggie arrived, we decided to get our feet wet by traveling with the McArdles to Ireland for 10 days.  We spent time in Dublin, Armagh, and Roscommon, with day visits to Dun Laoghaire and Galway.

Dublin

After arriving Friday morning, we spent the next 3 days being tourists in Dublin – visiting the Guinness Storehouse, St Stephen’s Green (multiple times for the playground!), Grafton Street, and lots more through the Dublin Road Train tour.  It was definitely a different experience visiting Dublin with a toddler – all the places (read: pubs) I’d visited in my most recent trips didn’t seem to be the best places for Maggie! We did find Dublin to be really child friendly though and even when we ended up in a pub, they were really welcoming!

Maggie having a blast touring Dublin

Dun Laoghaire

We had planned on visiting Dun Laoghaire for a day anyways, but when our great uncle Tom passed away, we headed down on the day of the wake.  We only had a few hours to kill, and the weather was not on our side, but we still managed to walk the pier and get ice cream at Teddy’s. Though it was for a sad occasion, we were able to see family that we hadn’t planned on seeing and it was great to be able to catch up.  Uncle Tom was a great man and will be very sorely missed.

 

Armagh (Northern Ireland)

After the day in DL, we headed up north to the McArdle farm.  We spent the next few days here visiting with the cows, walking the fields, going to Gosford Forest Park, and doing some shopping.  It was great to finally get to see the famed farm that we had all heard so much about!

Roscommon

On Thursday, we headed to Nana’s hometown of Roscommon to stay with the Fallon family.  It’s been a while since I’ve been back to Roscommon, and while much has changed, seeing “Nana’s castle” and the Moran grave brought back lots of memories of trips to Ireland as a kid.  We had a visit from our other cousin Ciara and her 2 little girls which was a great day (though poor Phelan was well outnumbered – 6 girls to 1 boy!).

The Fallon’s home was the perfect place to visit, kid-friendly, lots of space, and great hosts!  Maggie hasn’t stopped talking about Charlotte and Juliette – if only they lived closer!

 

Galway 

We popped into Galway for the day to see some family.  Was great to catch up with 2 of Nana’s sisters and lots of cousins – Pat finally understood why everyone is considered a “cousin”, even if technically they’re 2nd, 3rd, or even more distant, the extended Moran family is amazingly welcome to anyone who might share a drop of blood!  (We were too busy catching up to take any photos, but after brunch we wandered the city center a bit)

Fairy Day

The last day of the trip, we joined Steve, Goretti and the girls at a fundraiser Fairy Day – it was so sweet!! In honor of a local girl who was battling cancer, the fundraiser started last year and was a day of fun with fairies dancing, a magical walk through the woods, and lots of adorable little kids!

 

As with most vacations, it all went too quickly!! We’re missing everyone and already planning out the next time we can head over.  Maggie proved she’s a champion traveler with only taking 2 days on both ends to adjust to the time change and was great on the flights.

item.title: Summer, so far
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded:
I can’t believe it’s already August…despite no longer getting summers off as I once did, the idea of Back to School still gives me slight anxiety.  As always, summer has flown by so far, but looking back, we’ve packed in a good bit so far and plan to continue to do so through Labor Day!

We started the summer with a trip to Story Land with the McArdle and Jordan families, followed by a morning at the beach:

    

July quickly came which meant births and birthday parties! (see separate post for Maggie’s)

Happy Birthday Frankie!

and welcome to Aoife Teresa McArdle, born July 13, 2014.  We are all excited for the newest addition to the family, she’s just adorable!! And check out that head of hair (Maggie is jealous)!

 

We spent a long weekend in the Cape with the Healeys – which meant lots of beach, shopping, cribbage, and general relaxing!

 

Throughout the summer, Maggie has been mastering some new skills – using utensils, riding bikes, and accessorizing!

 

With only a month left to the summer, we’re hoping to soak up as many rays as we can!
